title: A support/mid from Noxus??
body:
Do you think that's something you would want to see?
I ask because I have a concept I am fine tuning and wonder if this would be something people besides me are wanting.

replies.body: I can't really see a Noxian support. Just because supporting seems so... anti-Noxian. Maybe a support that was from Noxus, but that's not really the same thing.

{{champion:412}}...

That being said, it can work. Besides, Noxian's might value strength, but in war efforts you need people to tend to those that do come back injured by war. Could be some kind of battle-medic for all we know. Perhaps a melee pseudo-carry?

Noxian's value individual strength. If you are injured, you take care of yourself. Look at Swain's lore. That's what a Noxian is supposed to be.

That said, it would be interesting to see a melee pseudo-carry support who didn't actually do normal support things, but instead had a duo-oriented mechanic, like if you're near a champion that has more gold/experience than you, your passive gold/experience increases.

That seems Noxian enough. Trying to learn from others to improve self.

I think this mechanic can work well for a jungler, too.
Well that's true, they only really have Elise and kinda sion Jung to.
Elise isn't even confirmed to be noxian.

Thresh isn't really strong in a way Noxus approves of. He simply preys on the vulnerable and takes pleasure in torturing people, just because he has a sick and twisted mind doesn't mean he is strong in a way that Noxus would appreciate.
what about a high kill pressure support (Like annie or blitzcrank) with an execute ult that gives full kill gold to allies
Morgana is the one you're looking for. She's not originally from Noxus, but she lives there according to lore and has always been considered as Noxian when it comes to things like that.
Noxus believes that the weak shouldn't be alive. A Noxian champion being a support would be breaking the rules of champion lore placement or something of that air.
Unless the support wasn't weak lore-wise! Like look at Thresh and Tahm Kench. You wouldn't say they were light-hearted and soft.

I doubt everyone in noxus is like that.

And even then you can make a support who has pretty much nothing that would imply he/she is weak on his/her own in the lore(like thresh or Tahm Kench) and make them more on the agressive side of supporting(one that doesn't protect his allies,but ccs his enemies)
But who supports their views?
